thread.title: Pro Football Hall of Fame expresses interest in hosting 2019 NFL Draft
thread.title_full: Pro Football Hall of Fame expresses interest in hosting 2019 NFL Draft

title: Pro Football Hall of Fame expresses interest in hosting 2019 NFL Draft
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Pro Football Hall of Fame expresses interest in hosting 2019 NFL Draft The Pro Football Hall of Fame has expressed interest in hosting the 2019 NFL Draft in Canton, where the hall of fame is located. Post to Facebook Pro Football Hall of Fame expresses interest in hosting 2019 NFL Draft The Pro Football Hall of Fame has expressed interest in hosting the 2019 NFL Draft in Canton, where the hall of fame is located.  //on.wkyc.com/1RTjFLL   Join the Conversation To   Pro Football Hall of Fame expresses interest in hosting 2019 NFL Draft Pro Football Hall of Fame expresses intereset in hosting 2019 draft Hilary Golston, WKYC-TV 12:19 a.m. EDT October 20, 2015 The Pro Football Hall of Fame in Canton. (Photo: Ryan Haidet, WKYC-TV) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CANTON, Ohio -- The Pro Football Hall of Fame has expressed interest in hosting the 2019 NFL Draft in Canton, where the hall of fame is located. 
Pete Fierle, the Hall of Fame's vice president of communications and special assistant to the president, tells WKYC Channel 3's Hilary Golston the draft would coincide with the completion of the "village" project. 
He said the Hall of Fame expressed interest in hosting the draft to the league three weeks ago. 
The application process is a long one. At this point, the HOF isn't quite clear what that will entail. 
The first phase of the visionary project includes the construction of new north stands and a fan plaza between the stadium and the Hall of Fame. 
A construction timeline has been created to ensure completion of the first phase in time for the 2016 Enshrinement Ceremony, NFL/Hall of Fame Game and Concert for Legends. 
All three marquee events of the annual Enshrinement Weekend are held at Tom Benson Hall of Fame Stadium. 
HOF Village includes eight main components planned to drastically change the campus into a spectacular destination. The key elements of the $476 million development project are: 
• Hall of Fame Museum 
• Tom Benson Hall of Fame Stadium/Sports & Entertainment Complex 
• Hotel & Conference Center 
• Hall of Fame NFL Experience 
• Youth Fields 
• Center for Excellence (Athletic Performance & Safety; Corporate Excellence; Coaches and Officials academies) 
• "Main Street Hall of Fame" (retail/restaurant/office space) 
Follow WKYC's Hilary Golston on Twitter at @HilaryWKYC or "like" her on Facebook <!--iframe--> Read or Share this story: http://on.wkyc.com/1RTjFLL TOP VIDEOS
